parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I take down, pull down, depose, destroy. From kata and haireomai; to lower demolish.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Chanaan, the early name of Palestine.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and a derivative of a compound of kleros and didomi; to be a giver of lots to each, i.e. to apportion an estate.
